## Enumerations

### anonymous enum  {#a15caddcf5c9b41f2f15c2ec363589f6c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="anonymous enum ">
Known synchronization scope IDs, which always have the same value.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="a15caddcf5c9b41f2f15c2ec363589f6ca6ee3fb8ea1d8946ee1f96ab1947b294a" />
<EnumerationListItem name="SingleThread">
Synchronized with respect to signal handlers executing in the same thread (= 0)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a15caddcf5c9b41f2f15c2ec363589f6caf9706a2e196638078e8323bfd9ba17de" />
<EnumerationListItem name="System">
Synchronized with respect to all concurrently executing threads (= 1)
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

All synchronization scope IDs that LLVM has special knowledge of are listed here. Additionally, this scheme allows LLVM to efficiently check for specific synchronization scope <a href="#a80741d3f96133391b683effd8e5b77f0">ID</a> without comparing strings.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/llvmcontext-h/#l00052">52</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/llvmcontext-h">LLVMContext.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
